title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 23 ยง 2.18 - Health provider violations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 23 ยง 2.18 - Health provider violations

State Regulations
(a) When a
complaint alleging patterns of overcharging by a health provider is received by
the Department, either in accordance with section 68.9 of Title 11 or from any
source, and the allegations, if true, would constitute a violation of Insurance

Law section 5108 or Part 68 of Title 11, a hearing shall be conducted in
accordance with this Part. (b) If
the Superintendent determines after a hearing that such violations have been
demonstrated, the determination, which shall include a statement of facts and
findings, shall be forwarded: (1)
in the case
of physicians and physicians' assistants, to the director of the Office of

Professional Medical Conduct, New York State Department of Health at the
appropriate address; and
(2)
in
the case of other health providers, to the director of the Office of

Professional Discipline, Education Department at the appropriate
address. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 23
ยง
2.18

Adopted

New

York State Register March 25, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 12, eff. 3/25/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
